item.title: I’m Elaine Bradley and I’m a Mormon
item.description: Mormon Elaine Bradley, drummer for the Neon Trees, knows her relationship with God gives her freedom. She never feels more alive than when she’s living the gospel of Jesus Christ. www.mormon.org/elaine

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Entertainer, and a Friendly Green Monster
item.description: Amos Watane is a Mormon performer who believes that God ultimately wants us to be happy. As Brobee (Yo Gabba Gabba!) he loves to sing, dance, and make children smile. See more at www.mormon.org/amos

item.title: I’m a Mormon, a Social Media Innnovator, and Microlender
item.description: What do tweets and microloans have in common? They are both ways Mormon Dave Hanley sees for helping others and improving the world. www.mormon.org/dave

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Ivy League Drop-out and Entrepreneur
item.description: It took smarts for Mick Hagen to get into Princeton. It took even more smarts for this Mormon entrepreneur to drop out and start a successful new business. More at www.mormon.org/mick

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Radio Show Host, and Happy Wife and Mom
item.description: As a radio host, Mormon Julie McGurk helps people see things in another way. With the help of the gospel of Jesus Christ, she has changed her own perspective on family. www.mormon.org/julie

item.title: I’m a Mormon, an Immigrant, and a Banker
item.description: The life of an immigrant family is difficult. Knowing that everyone is a child of God helps the Dominguez family celebrate the differences in the people around them. www.mormon.org/andres

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Pediatric Dentist, and Happy Father
item.description: A good attitude is key to a happy life for the Burns family. Between running a dental office and raising seven kids, the gospel of Jesus Christ helps them keep it all together. www.mormon.org/burns

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Mom of Two Autistic Boys, and a Teacher
item.description: Mormon Michelle Paniagua is not just a bilingual teacher. She’s also a mom of two autistic boys with special challenges of their own. See how faith guides her life at www.mormon.org/michelle

item.title: I’m a Mormon, an Enthusiastic Woman, and a Loving Wife
item.description: Sarah, a Mormon woman, does more than just form bake clubs and build her career. Thanks to her faith in the gospel of Jesus Christ, she knows who she is and where she’s going. www.mormon.org/sarahg

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Irish Hiker, and Respecting Husband
item.description: Religious freedom in Kenneth Barber’s home took on a new meaning when he became a Mormon but his wife did not. Their religious beliefs differ, but their respect is unanimous. www.mormon.org/people

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Motivational Teacher, and Grateful Son
item.description: Taking his immigrant mother’s advice to heart, Mormon motivational speaker Paul Sleem lives to teach the next generation what she taught him. See more at www.mormon.org/people

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Drama Teacher, and Devoted Wife and Mother
item.description: Jane’s family hasn’t always been as happy as it is now. Thanks to the teachings of Jesus Christ and the love she has for Him, her family is now back on track. www.mormon.org/people

item.title: I’m a Mormon, a Rugby Player, and I Serve Others
item.description: Taking a hit on the rugby pitch isn't the only thing that gets John’s adrenaline pumping. As a Mormon following Christ, he also thrives on serving his family and his community. www.mormon.org/people

item.title: I’m a Mormon, an Actress, and a Legal Advisor
item.description: Jacqui works hard to help those around her see how to stay true to themselves. She knows that because of her faith in Jesus Christ, she will remain true to herself. See more at www.mormon.org/jacqui

item.title: I’m a Mormon, a Barrister, and I’m Grateful for Trials
item.description: After scoliosis altered Mormon Lola Ogunbote’s dreams, she had to learn how to focus on the positive in her life. Now she can say that adversity is the backbone of her success. www.mormon.org/lola

item.title: I’m a Mormon, a Pilot, Volunteer Constable, and Father
item.description: As a Mormon, Dean Johnson has learned to lift his sights higher than the storms of life. Because of the gospel of Jesus Christ, he knows how to have hope in the future. More at www.mormon.org/dean

item.title: I’m Jason Smyth and I’m a Mormon
item.description: Four time Paralympic gold medalist Jason Smyth may have limited vision, but he never lets challenges limit what he can accomplish. He know his talents are blessing from God. www.mormon.org/jasons

item.title: I’m a Mormon, a Grandfather, and a Software Engineer
item.description: Jeremy Dick is a software engineer, musician, photographer, and a Mormon that knows, through his faith in Jesus Christ, that there is reason to find joy in his daily life. www.mormon.org/jeremyd

item.title: I’m a Mormon, an Osteopath, and a Loving Dad
item.description: As an Osteopath, Michael Pye helps relieve physical pain in others. His faith in the gospel of Jesus Christ helps him to know that God can ease all burdens. www.mormon.org/michael

item.title: I’m a Mormon, I Clean Carpets, and Cook Curry
item.description: As a carpet cleaner, working hard is something Mormon Mike Turvey has always done. It’s his love for his family and for Jesus Christ that helps him have the strength to carry on. www.mormon.org/miket

item.title: I’m a Mormon, a Leader of a Nonprofit, and a Texan
item.description: After finding his father homeless, Mormon Eric Cooper resolved to make a difference. Now he leads one of the most efficient nonprofits in the United States. www.mormon.org/eric

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Adoptee, and a Ballet Dancer
item.description: Teaching ballet allows Mormon Chris Fairbank to give back. Between the pirouettes and chassés, he sees that God has blessed him with a job and family that he loves. www.mormon.org/chrisf

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Canyoneer, and a Taxidermist
item.description: Stepping off cliffs is part of a normal workday for Mormon Clark Wiscombe. Like learning to trust his ropes, he’s learned to trust God to support him even when he stumbles. www.mormon.org/clark

item.title: I’m a Mormon, a Triathlete, and a Music Teacher
item.description: As Mormon Kirk Taylor prepares for his 9th iron man race, he feels he’s doing what makes him happy. He knows that going the extra mile gives him purpose and direction. www.mormon.org/kirk

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Georgia Peach, and Mother of a Deaf Son
item.description: When Mormon Sherri found out that her son was deaf, she was frozen with fear. With hope in Jesus Christ, she moves forward with faith and has learned to speak in another way. www.mormon.org/sherri

item.title: I’m a Mormon, a Teacher, and Truster of God
item.description: After a tragic accident, Mormon Judy Brock felt abandoned. She learned to see the miracles in her life and realized God had always been at her side. Read her story at www.mormon.org/judy

item.title: I’m a Mormon and Wife of a Fallen Soldier
item.description: Mormon Vendella has two heroes. One is her husband, who was killed in Iraq. The other is Jesus Christ, through whom she believes all things are possible. She tells her story at www.mormon.org/vendella

item.title: I’m a Mormon, a Cowboy, and a Rancher
item.description: As a true cowboy, Mormon Ron Brown is a passionate rancher. He’s also passionate about his love for Jesus Christ, through whom help always comes when it’s needed. www.mormon.org/browns

item.title: I’m a Mormon and Mother to 79 Orphaned Children
item.description: The letter contained a single phrase: “Come, all hands are needed.” So Cécile sold her Paris home, brought her hands to Nepal, and built an orphanage. More at www.mormon.org/Cecile

item.title: I'm Lindsey Stirling and I'm a Mormon
item.description: What do modern dance, classical violin, and techno music have in common? The answer is a spunky Mormon performer with a talent for multi-tasking! See how she does it at www.mormon.org/lindsey.

item.title: I’m a Mormon, a Musician, and a Future Father
item.description: Vasily, a Mormon living in Moscow, finds harmony in blessing others’ lives through music. For him, it is the tool that God uses to help us change and develop. See more at www.mormon.org/vasily

item.title: I’m a Mormon, a Business Man, and a Family Man
item.description: Elcio is a Mormon with many passions, from surfing to soccer, but the three things he’s most passionate about are his wife Juliana and his sons, Diego and Gabriel. See more at www.mormon.org/elcio

item.title: I’m a Mormon, a Dancer, and a Mom
item.description: As a teacher, a dancer, and a mother, Leila strives to give children the love and support that she never had as a child. See more at www.mormon.org/leila

item.title: I’m a Mormon, a Naval Carpenter, and a Helpful Husband
item.description: Carlos Galvão tries to pattern his life after the Savior, Jesus Christ. Maybe that is why he became a carpenter. Maybe that is why he is so devoted to his family. Maybe that is why he is smiling. See more at www.mormon.org/carlos

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Father, and Russian Neurosurgeon
item.description: Mormon Andrey Klimash always knew he wanted to be a doctor and a scientist. But he didn’t know his greatest work he would be starting a family and raising a brilliant daughter. See more at www.mormon.org/andrey

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Ruby Author, and a World-changer
item.description: “Matz” believes in changing the world with a keyboard. Although he has written software used world-wide, he feels it is more important to be a good father and a good Christian. See more at www.mormon.org/matz

item.title: I’m a Mormon, an Actor, and a Father
item.description: As a voice actor, José Luiz has many voices in his head. But the most important voice is the one that encourages him to be a better person, love his family, and follow Christ. See more at www.mormon.org/jose

item.title: I’m a Mormon, a Friend, and a Tokyo Girl
item.description: When Moe moved to Tokyo, she didn’t know it would be the last time she saw her father. Although she misses him every day, she knows he wants her to be happy. See more at www.mormon.org/moe

item.title: I’m a Mormon, a Doctor, and a Father
item.description: Mikhail and Valentina's daughter, Yulia, was their sunshine. When she passed away, life felt dark. But the gospel gives them joy and hope knowing that they will see her again. See more at www.mormon.org/mikhail

item.title: I’m a Mormon, a Student, and an Artist
item.description: Olga is a small town Mormon girl in a big city. She came for an education, but she is learning many things not taught in school—how to grow up, be independent, and find herself. See more at www.mormon.org/olga

item.title: I’m a Mormon, a Dancer, and a Survivor
item.description: Despite battling cancer, Felipe finds the strength in his Mormon faith to keep dancing and keep smiling through life. Trials, he says, can make the sun shine brighter. See more at www.mormon.org/felipe

item.title: I’m a Mormon. I’m a Mormon, too! Twins: Hope and Love
item.description: Nadejda and Lyuba look alike, but each is unique. Nadejda is positive and hopeful, Lyuba is loving and playful, and both of them are Mormons who love their brother, Jesus Christ. See more at www.mormon.org/nadejda

item.title: I’m a Mormon, a Firefighter, and a Kendo Master
item.description: Whether he is using a sword or a hose, Michio is a Mormon firefighter who is always ready to fight for what he believes in—protecting and serving others. More at www.mormon.org/michio

item.title: I’m a Mormon, a Choir Director, and a Musical Mom
item.description: When Tomoko’s daughter was diagnosed with cancer, music brought them strength to persevere. Now Tomoko shares that strength with others as a Mormon choir director. See more at www.mormon.org/tomoko

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Aerial Dancer, and London Aficionado
item.description: Our path in life is not always easy. When it becomes too difficult, trust in God who will grant us wings…like the ones Vanessa appears to wear when she dances. See more at www.mormon.org/Vanessa

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Neurologist, and Difference-Maker
item.description: Patrick is an Austrian neurologist at a hospital. Koko is an American scientist for the United Nations. They somehow found time to fall in love and now make time to raise a family in the Mormon faith. www.mormon.org/Patrick

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Student of Language, and Grateful German
item.description: Manuella’s mother brought her to Germany in search of a better life. Her African heritage makes her especially grateful for her educational opportunities and her Mormon faith. www.mormon.org/manuella

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Craftsman, and Teacher of Balance
item.description: Tamaya Kosei is an expert potter, but he thinks of himself as the clay that spins on his wheel, striving for balance and symmetry in all aspects of his life. See more at www.mormon.org/kosei

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Swiss Sculptor, and Family Man
item.description: Christian Bolt is a Mormon sculptor who breathes life and art into blocks of stone. His own life was like the rough-hewn stone, guided by the Master's hand. See more at www.mormon.org/Chrsitian.

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Gourmet Cheese-maker, and Father
item.description: Masanori is a Mormon dairy farmer who is up at the crack of dawn. His simple faith, work ethic, and family values are as refreshing as his gourmet cheese and well-kept farm. www.mormon.org/masanori

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Teacher, and Wandering Pilgrim
item.description: Wilfried Möller is a Mormon educator who has hiked over 20,000 kilometers and shows no signs of slowing down. See how he follows the footsteps of earlier Christian pilgrims www.mormon.org/wilfried

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Attentive Father, and Joyful Smiler
item.description: Kazuta Takara is a successful businessman with the best job—father. Whether he is surfing with his son or riding bikes with his daughter, Kazuta finds joy in every job, every day. www.mormon.org/kazuta

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Filmmaker, and Director of a Beautiful Family
item.description: Christian Vuissa is a Mormon filmmaker who believes that every choice we make is a page in the screenplay of our lives. See how he directs his daily screenplay at www.mormon.org/christianv

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Soccer Player, and Man with a Second Chance
item.description: When Bruno had a heart attack at the age of 44, it opened his eyes to way he was living his life. Now his heart feels stronger than ever because it’s full of love and joy. See more at www.mormon.org/bruno

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Trainer, and National Judo Champ
item.description: Karina Tapia Navas does not back down from a challenge. Whether it’s the national championships or keeping this Mormon Judo master healthy, she’s ready to win. www.mormon.org/Karina

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Happy Puerto Rican, and Newlywed
item.description: Loving your best friend is a good thing; Being in love with your best friend is even better. Meet Pedro, who was lucky enough marry his best friend—Lesley. See more at www.mormon.org/lesley.

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Adopted Father, and Costa Rican Pizza Chef
item.description: Freddy Marin is a Mormon who believes that there are no unwanted children, just unfound families. See how Freddy’s children found their family at www.mormon.org/freddy

item.title: I’m a Mormon, a Permaculture Gardener, and a Great Cook
item.description: Meet two of Mother Nature’s favorite children. Max and Evelyn are Mormons who believe that if we take care of the earth, the earth will take care of us. See more at www.mormon.org/Max

item.title: I’m a Mormon and Puerto Rican with Faith in God’s Plan
item.description: Nuria and Alex are Mormons who left everything behind to move back to the country where they were born —Puerto Rico. See their faith in action at www.mormon.org/nuria.

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Dominican Republic Professor, and Mother
item.description: Mirtha Gomez is a Mormon with many titles—Professor, Director, Boss—but for Mirtha, the most important title will always be: Mother. See more at www.mormon.org/mirtha

item.title: Fabrice: Mormon, French Pilot, Fan of the Pyrenees
item.description: French pilot Fabrice Tron sees God’s hand in the sky he flies through and the mountains he flies over.

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Father and Architect of my own destiny
item.description: Before he built great structures, Mormon architect Mark Manning built the confidence and attitude that helped him succeed. Sometimes the most important things built are on the inside. www.mormon.org/mark

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Costa Rican, and Charmer of the Viola
item.description: Irene Monterroso is a Mormon concert violist who believes that music teaches us that we are a part of something greater than ourselves.‬ www.mormon.org/irenem

item.title: I'm a Mormon, New York Comedian, and Dreamer
item.description: Jenna Kim Jones' favorite sound is laughter. She would do almost anything to hear it–anything except compromise her principles. She's proving being funny doesn't have to mean being crude. See more at www.mormon.org/jenna

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Professor, and Eco-Friendly Scientist
item.description: Dr. Livingstone sees the earth as a gift from God. He shows his appreciation for it by teaching students, composting, recycling, and embracing arboreal specimens. See more on this Mormon professor at www.mormon.org/kevinl

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Teacher, and Tongan Auntie
item.description: Nelisa Wolfgramm, a Polynesian Mormon, is proud to be Tongan. Getting in touch with her native culture gave her the power to change from a failing student into a successful teacher. See more at www.mormon.org/nelisa

item.title: I'm a Mormon, New York Mother, and Forgiving Daughter
item.description: Mormon Yew Yorker Kristy Glass learned about broken hearts at a very young age, but it wasn't until she was a mother herself that she learned how to mend them. See more at www.mormon.org/Kristy

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Sensei, and One-Legged Runner
item.description: A true karate master can overcome any challenge with faith, perseverance, and one strong leg. Tim Hurst, a Mormon marathon runner with one leg, finds strength in focusing on what he has. See more at www.mormon.org/Tim

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Geriatric Nurse, and Nigerian Native
item.description: Sunday Talabi knows how to enjoy life. He loves to laugh, bake, and dance the salsa. Even at work, this Mormon from Nigeria finds enjoyment in caring for and learning from his patients. Read more at www.mormon.org/Sunday

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Canadian Realtor, and Noble Uruguay Native
item.description: With a name like Noble, you have a lot to live up to, but for Canadian Mormon Adonal Noble, it’s more than just a name. He has the heart to match. A heart big enough for two countries. See more at www.mormon.org/adonal

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Team-Player, and Proud Grandfather
item.description: For Mormon athlete Brian Going, family has always been a team. Whether he is playing professional rugby with his brothers or fishing with his grandsons, he always puts his team first. See more at www.mormon.org/BrianG.

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Flight Nurse, and Strong Rock in Tragedy
item.description: Flight nurse and Mormon Lori McBride is faced with life and death situations, which sometimes end tragically. But passion for her job and a belief in life after death give her strength. See more at www.mormon.org/Lori

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Taiwan Beach Surfer, and Forgiving Daughter
item.description: For Monica Lin, life is too precious to waste on anger. She has too much to do - like surfing in Taiwan. She's a Mormon with a heart for adventure. Visit Monica's page at www.mormon.org/monica

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Scoutmaster, and Connecticut Police Sergeant
item.description: Whether he’s working with his sons and local youth as a Mormon Scoutmaster or with the local gangs as a police officer, Chip White believes youth can be taught to be the leaders of the future. More at www.mormon.org/chip

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Architect, and Student of Patience
item.description: Whether she is building homes or building relationships, Mormon architect Bev Gosling has learned that good things in life and marriage take time. Visit Bev’s page at www.Mormon.org/Bev

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Former Ballerina, and Fashion Executive
item.description: Athelia Lesueur, a Mormon ballerina, always thought her life would be dance. When health challenges derailed her plans, Athelia discovered another passion: fashion. Visit Athelia's page at mormon.org/Athelia

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Physician, and Immigrant Son
item.description: The Mormon son of immigrant parents, Javier believes that his work as a doctor allows him to change other people's lives for good. See more about Javier at mormon.org/Javier

item.title: I'm a Mormon and Former Professional Football Player
item.description: Mormon athlete Chad Lewis played professional football and recently hiked Mount Kilimanjaro with four wounded warriors. He appreciates the great challenges of life and those who face them. More at www.mormon.org/chad

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Musician in Training, and Homeless Advocate
item.description: Denny Hancock is a Mormon superhero. Despite a brain injury, he is saving the world with a carpet truck full of food for the hungry and a little piece of home for the homeless. Read more at www.mormon.org/denny

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Country Girl, and Traveling Artist
item.description: Kathy Peterson's a farm girl but believes in the importance of travel. It's through other countries, cultures and faiths that Kathy receives inspiration as a Mormon artist. See more about Kathy at www.mormon.org/kathy

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Family Man, and Professional Snowboarder
item.description: As a kid, professional snowboarder and Mormon Jeremy Jones' first priority was his sport. Now, his family not only comes first, but it provides his spiritual foundation. See more about Jeremy at www.mormon.org/Jeremy

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Loyal Daughter, and Aspiring Journalist
item.description: From an immigrant childhood to the newsrooms of New York City, Anita is living proof that even humble beginnings can turn into great endings. See more about this Mormon newswoman's story at www.mormon.org/Anita

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Vietnam Veteran, and Italian Brooklynite
item.description: Frank Manusetto's Brooklyn accent and Sicilian American attitude endear him to everyone. As a Mormon Vietnam war veteran, he gained a deep understanding that second chances are possible. See more at www.mormon.org/Frank

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Firearms Commander, and Survivor of Change
item.description: Mormon firearms commander Richard Auger retired from a high-pressure job to face a different kind of pressure: major life changes. See how he deals with them at www.mormon.org/richard

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Doctor, and Alzheimer’s Researcher
item.description: Mormon researcher Ryan Watt's passion for finding a cure for Alzheimer's, Lou Gehrig's, and Parkinson's diseases is personal. It’s fueled by his family and his belief in Jesus Christ. Read more at www.mormon.org/Ryanwatts

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Amputee and Conqueror of Fears
item.description: Ingrid Maldonado lost her legs, but still stands tall. When you look in her eyes, you will not find frailty, but strength. You will not see fear, but hope. See photos at www.mormon.org/IngridM

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Professional Rugby Player, and Missionary
item.description: At age 19, Will Hopoate is a professional rugby player. He will soon be a Mormon missionary and sees it as a chance to thank God for his blessings. View Will’s video portrait at www.mormon.org/william

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Australian Singer, and New Wife and Mother
item.description: Mormon entertainer Patrice Arkins loves the feeling of singing at the top of her lungs in Australia's theaters, but she's most grateful for the feelings of peace that comes from family. See more at www.mormon.org/patrice

item.title: I'm a Mormon and an Aboriginal Father of Five Girls
item.description: A proud aboriginal man, Deon Davis works to promote health and acceptance among his native community. He's also a Mormon working hard to help his five daughters appreciate their heritage. See more at www.mormon.org/deon

item.title: I'm a Mormon, World Squash Champion, and Imperfect Mother
item.description: Years after conquering the game of squash, Mormon world champion Leilani Rorani learned that conquering the challenges of life requires a different type of perfection. Visit Leilani's page at www.mormon.org/leilani

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Scientist, and Australian Abalone Hunter
item.description: Grant Leeworthy is an Australian abalone hunter, fishery scientist, former rock-n-roller, and family man. Above all, he’s a believer in a God who made the world around us. Read more about Grant at www.mormon.org/grant

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Pro Basketball Player, and Sandwich Maker
item.description: Paora Winitana doesn’t want to come in second-He wants to win, both as a Mormon professional basketball player in New Zealand and as a father to three energetic little boys. See more about Paora at www.mormon.org/paora

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Kiwi, Mother, and Polkadot Entertainer
item.description: She’s a Polkadot. He’s a Polkadot groupie. She’s an eyebrow guru. He’s a crown prosecutor. But best of all, she’s a nutter and he adores her for it. See more on this Mormon couple at www.mormon.org/dionne

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Publicist, and Aussie Country Girl
item.description: Sarah Osmotherly is an Aussie country girl who is the life of the party. But a call from her daughter prompted Sarah to embrace a quieter life at home instead. See Sarah and her family at www.mormon.org/sarah

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Highland Rugby Coach, National Champ 19 of 26 Years
item.description: Highland High rugby won 19 of 26 nat'l champions. Mormon head coach and subject of a feature film Larry Gelwix credits this to preparing his boys not only for their next game, but for life. More at www.mormon.org/larry

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Early Riser, and New Zealand Dairy Farmer
item.description: Butch Horsford, a Mormon dairy farmer in New Zealand, believes that good things take time. From shearing sheep to a lifetime of marriage, doing a proper job takes dedication. See more about Butch at www.mormon.org/butch

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Father, and High-Speed Motorcycle Trainer
item.description: Mormon motorcycle trainer Steve Brouggy knows what it's like to ride at 200 km an hour. He also knows what it's like to lose a father. Through the highs and lows, he holds on to his faith. See more at www.mormon.org/steve

item.title: I'm a Mormon, French Opera Singer, and History Buff
item.description: For Alexis, music is an unspoken communication, a sharing of the heart. As an opera singer, flutist and lover of history, this Mormon Frenchman finds beauty in what has come before him. Read more at www.mormon.org/Alexis

item.title: I'm a Mormon, a Blind Guitarist, and Australian Cyclist
item.description: Blind, Mormon guitarist Lorin Nicholson rode a bike from Perth to Sydney, but he didn’t see the country. He heard, felt, and smelled it. To him it was beautiful. Witness Lorin's love of life at www.mormon.org/lorin

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Husband, and Excited, Instant Father
item.description: He's an outdoor enthusiast and a landscaper. She's into décor and fashion. Their lives went on hold when they got a call about adopting an Apache baby...that day. Learn about this Mormon couple at www.mormon.org/chance

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Research Scientist, and Unicyclist
item.description: Tom Ngo is many things: a Mormon, a physicist, a unicyclist, a businessman, an entrepreneur, a father and a husband. One thing he is not is a blind follower. See more about Tom at www.mormon.org/Tom

item.title: I'm a Mormon, French-Swiss, and Blind Chocolate Hunter
item.description: He is a blind connoisseur of good food in Geneva, Switzerland. She is his eyes. Together, this Mormon couple explores their city, eats chocolate and makes each other laugh. Visit Pierre page at www.mormon.org/pierre

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Olympic Medalist, and Retired Swimmer at 24
item.description: Mormon Olympic medalist Lacey John was obsessed with shaving time off of her swimming record until she became the best. Now she's finding other areas of her life to improve. See more at www.mormon.org/lacey

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Mother, Grandmother, and Foster Parent
item.description: Elizabeth takes in anything to which she can offer a better life – children, animals, garage sale items. She's a Mormon set on making a difference. See more at www.mormon.org/elizabeth

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Optimist, and Wounded Soldier
item.description: Calling home after his injury in Iraq was hard for Erick Lund, but the terrors of war made this Mormon grateful for his family, the soldiers who carried him to safety, and his wife's socks. More at www.mormon.org/erick

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Mother, Survivor and Cancer Fighter
item.description: Tessa Winger was diagnosed with Hodgkin's lymphoma at 16. Now the cancer is back. But this radiant Mormon mother of two feels the hand of God in her life. See Tessa's story at www.mormon.org/Tessa

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Bolivian Mother, and Artistic Dentist
item.description: Ruth Wise loves being a mom. She loves being a dentist. And she loves getting a little blood on herself now and then. She's a Bolivian-born Mormon making a better life for her family. Read more at www.mormon.org/ruth

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Nigerian-American, and Athlete turned Artist
item.description: He came to the United States from Nigeria to play college basketball, but Mormon artist Nnamdi Okonkwo followed his true passion: creating art that reflects the noble spirit of people. See more at www.mormon.org/nnamdi

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Mother, and Caretaker of Bulgarian Orphans
item.description: Mormon mother Deborah Gardner cares for not only her own five children, but thousands of Bulgarian orphans whose physical and emotional needs are met through her service. See more at www.mormon.org/deborah

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Bee Keeper, and Proud Italian Father
item.description: Mormon architect and bee keeper Marco Petrollini doesn't always know why he's smiling. But by being dedicated to God and his family, he finds happiness that comes from caring. Read more at www.mormon.org/marco

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Frenchman, and a Trilingual Family Father
item.description: In French, Spanish or English, the message from this Latina Mother and French Father is the same: Maria and Samuel Babins love their children. They're a multicultural Mormon family. Meet them all at www.mormon.org/samuel

item.title: I'm a Mormon, High School Student, and Humanitarian
item.description: As a high school senior, Lisa has a lot to celebrate: yoga, ice cream, basketball, her journal. But her work with Operation Smile in Jordan gave this Mormon teen the most to smile about. See more at www.mormon.org/lisa

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Urban School Teacher, and Rocking Partier
item.description: Washington D.C. urban schoolteacher Sheryl Garner knows she's a child of God. Her faith helps her love the children she teaches. Her joy adds to a rocking parties with friends. See Sheryl at www.mormon.org/sheryl

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Immigrant, and University Law Professor
item.description: Mormon Law Professor Mehrsa Bybee wants both her law students and little girls to be a force for good. She sets the example, and looks to her heritage and grandmother for strength. Learn more at www.mormon.org/mehrsa

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Cultural Mesh, and Self-Invented Cook
item.description: Nadia Las Deskins is a Mormon mother devoted to passing on her Persian heritage. She teaches her children Farsi, cooks her grandmother's recipes, and makes room for one more at the table. See more at www.mormon.org/nadia

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Rock and Ice Climber, and Family-Motivated Man
item.description: Mormon climber Matthieu Bennasar has been conquering mountains since he was ten. But it's the bond he shares with his family that gets him through life's toughest climbs. More on Matthieu at www.mormon.org/matthieu

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Karate Master, and Mother-to-Be
item.description: Reine gave up karate competitions because they were on Sundays. But that opened new doors: a husband, pregnancy, and degree in corporate law. Now if only her husband could spell her name. See more at www.mormon.org/Reine

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Fine Press Owner, and Letterpress Printer
item.description: For Mormon letterpress printer Rob Buchert, making beautiful books gives him quiet time to contemplate the art of the creative process. See more about Rob at www.mormon.org/rob.

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Caring Father, and Austrian Concert Manager
item.description: Viennese concert manager Helmut Wondra loves his job, but even more he loves coming home to his family. He's a Mormon father who loves his boys the same way he believes God loves him. See more at www.mormon.org/helmut

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Musician, and Laser-Loving Physics Professor
item.description: Norman is the first to admit that there are some wild people who are physicists, and he’s one of them. But in addition to being a Mormon man of science, he’s also a man of faith. Read more at www.mormon.org/norman

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Mother, and Spanish Newscaster
item.description: For Spaniard Irene and her husband, the best financial solution after their son was born was for Irene to keep working as a producer and anchor at a Spanish language daily newscast. Read more at www.mormon.org/Irene

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Mission President, and Professional Golfer
item.description: Meet Bruce Summerhays, a former professional golfer who now volunteers full-time—as a mission president—leading a large group of Mormon missionaries. See more about Bruce at www.mormon.org/bruce

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Viennese Violinmaker, and Fantastic Aunt
item.description: As a Mormon violinmaker in Vienna, Henriette's goal is to make an instrument that reflects both the personality of its player and maker. Kind of like us, as God's creation. Read more at www.mormon.org/henriette

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Parisian, and Mother of 7
item.description: Nadja Pettitt speaks a half-dozen languages, lives in Paris, and when she's not busy raising seven kids, she runs her own business. It's her own way of raising a happy Mormon family. See more at www.mormon.org/nadja

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Athlete, and Amputee who Built a Leg
item.description: Jarem Frye is a bone cancer survivor and amputee who built his own replacement leg so he could mountain bike, rock climb, water and snow skiing - he does it all. See Jarem in action at www.mormon.org/jarem

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Grandpa, and Amusement Ride Inventor
item.description: Stan Checketts is a Mormon inventor who is always thinking about the creation of his next high-thrill amusement ride. But what brings lasting happiness are his family and his faith. See more at www.mormon.org/stan

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Aunt, and Award Winning Math Teacher
item.description: Freedom within structure. Mormon teacher Yvette Yamagata believes this helped her win the Presidential Award for Excellence in Mathematics and Science Teaching. It's also how she views life. More at www.mormon.org/yvette

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Polynesian Father, and Former NFL Player
item.description: NFL player Gabe Reid thought about giving up, but persevered and played with the Chicago Bears and the Tennessee Titans. Now this Mormon father of four teaches his kids to never quit. Read more at www.mormon.org/gabe

item.title: I'm a Mormon and Tax Attorney Turned Rocker
item.description: Jason Slatter's wife says he rocks. Literally. He left a big tax firm, opened his own practice, and now rocks out with his wife and kids as the Mormon owner of a School of Rock in Idaho. See more at www.mormon.org/jason

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Devoted Mother, and Avid Photographer
item.description: Shawni Pothier admits that motherhood is an experiment and her parenting strategies work about half the time. Still, she 's a Mormon mother who finds joy in capturing precious moments. See Shawni at www.mormon.org/shawni

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Regional Artist, and Life Balance Seeker
item.description: Brian Kershisnik is a Mormon artist at work: at work on his paintings, on his faith, and on his family. The complications and beauty of this journey inspire his art. See more at www.mormon.org/brian

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Rock Crawler, and Reformed Husband
item.description: He's a jeep enthusiast and Harley driver; she's a TV chef. This Mormon couple may not seem like an ideal match, but their story is one of friendship, forgiveness, faith and lifelong love. See more at www.mormon.org/Allan

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Restaurant Owner, and Food Connoisseur
item.description: A busy Mormon restaurant owner describes his passion for his career as well as his quest for a balanced family life. See more about Colton at www.mormon.org/colton

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Vegetarian, and Green Energy Business Owner
item.description: To say Byron loves the planet may be an understatement. As the Mormon owner of a green energy company, he believes we are responsible for the air, the water, and the way we treat each other. More at www.mormon.org/byron

item.title: I'm a Mormon, a Mother, and Finnish Born Photographer
item.description: For Beatta Bosworth, home is where you make memories with the people you love. This Mormon mother is doing just that, and uses photography to stay in touch with her own Finnish home. See more at www.mormon.org/beatta

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Scientist, and Cancer Researcher
item.description: As a man of science and faith, Sergio Sanchez is a Mormon searching for the truth, both personally and professionally. Despite failures, he believes each day brings him closer to it. See Sergio at www.mormon.org/sergio

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Chinese American, and Transformed Husband
item.description: A few years ago, Chinese American John Chen was hitting middle age, working too hard, and spending too little time with his family. Now things are different for this Mormon family man. Read more at www.mormon.org/john

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Single Dad, Designer, Baseball Coach
item.description: Robert Comstock is a New York fashion designer who wanted to leave his mark on the world. Now, a single Mormon father, he sees his greatest creations aren't the clothes, but his sons. See more at www.mormon.org/robert

item.title: I’m a Mormon and Motorcycle Sculptor for Harley Davidson
item.description: Jeff Decker is a Mormon motorcycle enthusiast who sculpts artwork of Harley Davidson motorcycles. He strives for balance in life and is grateful for his family and beliefs that help him. Read more at www.mormon.org/jeff

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Texan, and Mother of Two Disabled Sons
item.description: Rochelle Tallmadge is a Mormon mom of four. Two of her boys have special needs. See why she believes they're here to bring love to the world and teach the rest of us compassion. See more at www.mormon.org/rochelle.

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Former Journalist, and Dedicated Mother
item.description: Jane Clayson Johnson once interviewed the U.S. President and anchored Good Morning America. Then this Mormon woman put her plans on hold to fulfill another lifelong dream: become a mother. See more at www.mormon.org/jane

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Mother, and Filipino-American Artist
item.description: A talented Filipino-American artist, Rose Dall, notes her greatest life's work is not her paintings but her family. The effects of mothering, she says, will far outlast her career. Read more at www.mormon.org/rose

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Neighborhood Attorney, and 9-11 Survivor
item.description: For years, Mormon attorney Victor worked tirelessly in the World Trade Center. Out of the house before his family woke up, home after they went to bed. On Sept 11th, 2001, all that changed. More at www.mormon.org/victor

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Recovering Addict, and Better Son
item.description: Mexican Mormon Valentin Pavia found the strength he needed to overcome addiction when he found faith in Jesus Christ. Now he's a better son for his mother and looking forward to the future. More at www.mormon.org/valentin

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Pediatrician, and Humanitarian
item.description: Encouraged by his belief in Jesus Christ and family support, Mormon Pediatrician Ryan Wilcox joined an effort to reduce the #1 cause of newborn deaths around the world. See Ryan's experience at www.mormon.org/ryan

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Ping Pong King, and Making My Mother Proud
item.description: Paris Thomas had a hard childhood. See how this Mormon teen came to know peace, and why he doesn't blame his circumstances, but believes they've made him a stronger person. Visit Paris' page at www.mormon.org/paris.

item.title: I'm a Mormon, New York Music Executive, Father of 4
item.description: Ryan Wright is a Mormon music executive living with his family in New York. See why he believes having a little free time to himself makes him a better father, husband and employee. See more at www.mormon.org/ryanw

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Mother of Five, and Believer in Miracles
item.description: Jenny Hess is a Mormon mother of five kids. When one was lost in an accident, it was almost too much to bear. Believing in miracles didn't bring him back but it did help her heal. More at www.mormon.org/jenny

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Urban School Teacher, and Rocking Partier
item.description: Washington D.C. urban schoolteacher Sheryl Garner knows she's a child of God. Her faith helps her love the children she teaches. Her joy adds to a rocking parties with friends. See Sheryl at www.mormon.org/sheryl

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Wife, and Dedicated Blogger
item.description: Mormon blogger Daisy Chou thought she had her spirituality figured out; be a good person, do good things, don't steal or lie. Then she discovered what was missing. Learn more at www.mormon.org/daisy

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Dentist, and Supplier of Smiles in Honduras
item.description: A Mormon dentist serves the people of Roaton, Honduras by establishing a free dental clinic. See more about Kelly Lineback at www.mormon.org/kelly

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Single Mother, and Special Needs Advocate
item.description: Even as a single parent, Anne Row is a Mormon mother who turns her hardships into courage, faith, and love for others. See more about Anne at www.mormon.org/anne

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Cowboy at Heart, and Father of Five
item.description: Drew Johnson is a Mormon investment banker striving to stay true to his cowboy roots while raising a family of five. See more about Drew at www.mormon.org/drew

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Mother of Three, and Joyful Artist
item.description: As a free-spirited mother, Cassandra Barney encourages her children to explore creativity in her studio. Family and career blend for this Mormon artist like the colors on her brush. See more at www.mormon.org/cassandra

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Cyclist, and Library of Congress Director
item.description: Chris Carlson is a husband, father, photographer, cyclist and Mormon. He works at the U.S. Library of Congress helping to make 150 million collection items accessible via the web. Read more at www.mormon.org/chris

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Marine, Olympian, and Grateful Husband
item.description: Ian Harvey is an accomplished marine and Olympian as well as a happily married man. He loves life, and has discovered something that makes it even better. Read more at www.mormon.org/ian

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Father, and Homeland Security Expert
item.description: Despite having muscular dystrophy, Mormon Homeland Security Consultant Vance Taylor shows that a normal life is possible and that real happiness comes through family relationships. See Vance at www.mormon.org/vance

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Astronaut Fan, and Former NASA Flight Director
item.description: A 26-year Mormon NASA veteran reflects on his past experiences and looks to a bold new adventure in his retirement. See more at www.mormon.org/rond

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Husband, and Father of a Strong Family
item.description: Mike Lohner's Mormon family celebrates their lives together. Through their challenges they remain positive and energized as a family. Visit Mike's page at www.mormon.org/mike

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Illustrator, and Robot Fanatic
item.description: For Mormon artist Spencer Nugent, sketchbooks are like journals. He believes creativity can help connect people in a completely unique way, and help to improve their lives. Visit Spencer's page at www.mormon.org/spencer

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Public Health Advocate and Mother of Three
item.description: Emily and Aaron Sherinian are two working Mormon parents, striving to maintain their hectic professional schedules while staying focused on their family. See more about the Sherinians at www.mormon.org/emily

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Addict Caretaker, and Voice for the Homeless
item.description: Sally Marks draws upon Christ-like empathy to help the homeless and those recovering from addiction. She's a Mormon who sees herself as a voice for those whom society can't hear. Read more at www.mormon.org/sally

item.title: I'm a Mormon, British Born Musician, and Set on Service
item.description: Rising from a life on the streets of London, Mormon recording artist Alex Boye now entertains audiences worldwide. He believes music heals the soul and is set on using it for that purpose. Learn more www.mormon.org/alex

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Hawaiian, and Professional Surfer
item.description: A professional surfer and Hawaiian Mormon talks about positioning yourself to take advantage of the opportunities you have in life. Read more at www.mormon.org/joy
